name: BEST WESTERN Hotel Du Lavarin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a lovely stay at the Lavarin. Staff were very helpful, rooms were comfortable and bed nice. The pool area is spotless and the pool very nice. The only thing that lets this down is if you are planning on spending a lot of time in Avignon and dont have a car. The hotel is a 30 minute walk from the city centre and the taxi's are not cheap in this part of the world so if you want to be exploring Avignon a lot then I'd stay nearer the city centre. The hotel is also quite expensive for simple items like water - pick some up before you get here. We had a great stay here and were quite happy to stop by the pool for a day and explore the town for a day.
reviews.title: Very nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Du Lavarin on a trip through Provence as we visited Avignon. The staff was delightful and helped with directions and a dinner reservation.
reviews.title: Wonderful modern small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was newly renovated with a wonderful shower, so rare in France. The price was moderate and we had a very enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Modern style in historical town

reviews.text: The hotel managers were extremely cheerful, friendly & helpful. The hotel lobby, resturant and rooms were in clean and decorated in a very fresh and modern style. We really enjoyed our time there.
reviews.title: Good hotel with budget price for France

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was a bit far from the main city center, but the hotel did offer rental bicycles and had a secure car park. Don't try to walk to the city center as it is a bit far on foot. Instead, use thier taxi pick up service, bike or rental car. Also, there is no nearby supermarkets to the hotel, so when you go into town pick up any essential or grocaries you may need.
reviews.title: Good quiet hotel outside Avignon
Out of Town but a good hotel
reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel last year and was a little concerned having read some iof the reviews. As it turned out I was pleasantly surprised. Although it is well outside the old part of Avignon, it was an easy cycle ride with marked cycle routes. The hotel was clean and the food was basic but good. We had an enjoyable stay- based on some other hotels in the 'Best Western' stable, this was was good, with brilliant service.

reviews.title: A real let down for a relatively good chain.
reviews.text: The pool, when we went, was hardly ever used so every day we were able to use it on our return every evening, often having the pool & area to ourselves.

reviews.title: A good experience.
reviews.text: The room was extortionate, the food was terrible and it smelt like someone had repeatedly vomited. The legs on the single bed broke half way through the night and I'm not sure when the blankets or anything else had been washed, it hadn't been recently.

reviews.title: A Pleasant Surprise
reviews.text: This was the first stop on a large group tour of southern France and Italy. The location is great for large groups - big parking lot and adequate dining room. Overall the experience was positive.

The hotel is right behind an Office Depot, so don't expect to wander the charming streets of Avignon from this hotel - it is a cab ride to the city center. But for groups, the parking lot was great (easy to transport bags from the room to the bus).
reviews.title: Hotel is O.K. but nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking for a good value hotel with secure parking in or close to Avignon and Du Lavarin seemed to tick the boxes. Located a five minute drive outside the town, it was easy to find, near the hospital, which is sign-posted from everywhere. Check-in was simple and fast, the bedroom and bathroom were small but perfectly adequate and clean. We intended to use the hotel simply for sleeping in and it was fine for that purpose. There was a kettle and plastic cups in the room. The TV channels were all French but we only watched it for the news and weather. There was a computer in the lobby, with internet access that was free for guests' use.
reviews.title: Good value, secure parking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the first day we arrived in the evening so we ate in the hotel. We sat outside on the terrace and had a nicely cooked meal with efficent and pleasant service at a price similar to what we would pay in the UK. We got a deal that included breakfast as we had read the reviews on here that said it was expensive and I can confirm that you would definitely not want to pay 13 euros for it.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay close to a fascinating city.

reviews.text: As we had a car and wanted to see a lot of Provence we were out every day and didn't return to the hotel until after dinner. The hotel served its purpose and worked for us as a base and provided us with the free secure parking that the town centre hotels generally lacked.
reviews.title: Wonderful ambience, owners/managers are the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a week at the Lavarin. Check-in quick, friendly and efficient. Public area of hotel recently refurbished. Rooms on small side and a little tired decor-wise but comfortable beds. Quiet. Free wifi. Tea/coffee making materials. TV. Small bathroom but good shower. Standard buffet breakfast but expensive at 13€/head. Interesting food at restaurant for dinner. But eccentric service - main course served 15 seconds (at most) after finishing first course. Hotel a 30 minute walk from Avignon and the sites. Bus stop outside hotel. Number 3 - a ten minute ride to town centre. Single ticket costs 1.20€. Pay the driver - having exact money helps. Buses run every 20 minutes but last one back to hotel is a very early 20.00hrs. So late night in Avignon means a taxi back to the hotel. Alternative is to eat in the hotel every evening becauwe there are no bars/restaurants nearby. Oh nearly forgot - hotel has a garden (where it is possible to eat breakfast/dinner) and a small pool. The latter not used.
reviews.title: Surprising little hotel

reviews.text: This hotel was our surprise during our European visit - I have to tell you that Patricia (co-owner/manager) and her husband, Simon really went out of their way to make myself and my 13 yr old daughter feel welcome. The pool and patio were beautiful and the rooms were adequate, sson to be renovated to my understanding. This is a place that really caters to their guests. A cheery "bon jour" always greeted us and we only had to ask for anything we needed. We were blessed to have met Patricia and Simon, as they really catered to my daughter and I, unexpectedly, helping us with transportation! The Continental breakfast was outstanding and prepared to cover all tastes. We dined by the pool one evenng and were amazed at the lovely meal. My only regret is that this place isn't closer to my home, or we would go more often- very much a getaway palce where I felt safe and cared for!
reviews.title: Very pleasant and very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although out of the town, the staff were very friendly. We stayed for 4 nights as part of the Etape Du Tour and had half board. The food was very good, considering they were catering for 40+. The staff were very helpful. The bedrooms need updating, but for the amount of time spent in our room, this was not an issue. The pool area is very relaxing and Avignon old town is only a 5 minute taxi ride.
reviews.title: Very Friendly Staff

reviews.text: If in Avignon again, would stay at the Du Lavarin
reviews.title: Modern and quiet hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've been stayed in this hotel for 1 night. The entrance was very nice. The staff was welcoming and speaks pretty good English.
reviews.title: Eh.

reviews.text: Check-in was quick and the room was clean and nice.
reviews.title: Just OK
Nice But Off The Beaten Track
reviews.text: The hotel has a swimmingpool outsite with a nice midterranian garden. The Restaurant is not high cuisine but the food tasted nice with good service. If you want you can have your diner/breakfast in the garden (recommended).

description: Modern, two story hotel with restaurant, situated in suburban area; close to historic sites, wine trails and Lavender Country.
